Description: QF2 for AWS has the highest performance of any file storage system in the public cloud and a complete set of enterprise features, such as support for SMB, real-time visibility into the storage system, directory-based capacity quotas, and snapshots.

ClusterPrivateIPs.Description: List of the private IPs of the nodes in your QF2 Cluster

LinkToManagement.Description: Click to launch the QF2 Admin Console

QumuloKnowledgeBase.Description: Qumulo Knowledge Base for QF2 in public clouds

TemporaryPassword.Description: Temporary admin password for your QF2 cluster (matches node1 instance ID)

ClusterName.ConstraintDescription: Name must be an alpha-numeric string between 2 and 15 characters. Dash (-) is allowed if not the first or last character.
ClusterName.Description: QF2 cluster name (2-15 alpha-numeric characters and -)

InstanceType.ConstraintDescription: Must be a Qumulo supported EC2 instance type.
InstanceType.Description: EC2 instance type for QF2 node

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the node

SubnetId.ConstraintDescription: Must be the ID of an existing Subnet.
SubnetId.Description: ID of the Subnet in which to deploy QF2.

VpcId.ConstraintDescription: Must be the ID of an existing VPC.
VpcId.Description: ID of the VPC in which to deploy QF2.

Properties.GroupDescription: Enable ports for NFS/SMB/FTP, Management, Replication, and Clustering.

SecurityGroupIngress.Description: TCP ports for NFS, SMB, FTP, Management, and Replication
